channel.title: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade
channel.description:
Hello! After the update I have removed package virtualbox-guest-x11 and does not want to install because of dependencies. How to fix this error? I have no functionality from these extensions that interfere with my work.
[details="Summary"] > Calculating upgrade... Done > The following packages will be REMOVED: > virtualbox-guest-x11 > The following packages will be upgraded: > libmysqlclient18 mysql-common mysql-server-core-5.5 virtualbox-guest-dkms virtualbox-guest-utils > 5 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 1 to remove and 0 not upgraded. > Need to get 5,434 kB of archives. > After this operation, 4,452 kB disk space will be freed. > Do you want to continue? [Y/n] Y > Get:1 http://deb.whonix.org/ jessie-proposed-updates/main virtualbox-guest-utils i386 5.1.30-dfsg-1~bpo9+1 [402 kB] > Get:2 http://security.debian.org/ jessie/updates/main mysql-common all 5.5.59-0+deb8u1 [80.2 kB] > Get:3 http://security.debian.org/ jessie/updates/main libmysqlclient18 i386 5.5.59-0+deb8u1 [689 kB] > Get:4 http://deb.whonix.org/ jessie-proposed-updates/main virtualbox-guest-dkms all 5.1.30-dfsg-1~bpo9+1 [599 kB] > Get:5 http://security.debian.org/ jessie/updates/main mysql-server-core-5.5 i386 5.5.59-0+deb8u1 [3,664 kB] > Fetched 5,434 kB in 1min 11s (75.8 kB/s) > (Reading database ... 106966 files and directories currently installed.) > Removing virtualbox-guest-x11 (4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1) ... > Processing triggers for man-db (2.7.0.2-5) ... > Processing triggers for libc-bin (2.19-18+deb8u10) ... > (Reading database ... 106948 files and directories currently installed.) > Preparing to unpack .../mysql-common_5.5.59-0+deb8u1_all.deb ... > Unpacking mysql-common (5.5.59-0+deb8u1) over (5.5.58-0+deb8u1) ... > Preparing to unpack .../libmysqlclient18_5.5.59-0+deb8u1_i386.deb ... > Unpacking libmysqlclient18:i386 (5.5.59-0+deb8u1) over (5.5.58-0+deb8u1) ... > Preparing to unpack .../mysql-server-core-5.5_5.5.59-0+deb8u1_i386.deb ... > Unpacking mysql-server-core-5.5 (5.5.59-0+deb8u1) over (5.5.58-0+deb8u1) ... > Preparing to unpack .../virtualbox-guest-utils_5.1.30-dfsg-1~bpo9+1_i386.deb ... > Unpacking virtualbox-guest-utils (5.1.30-dfsg-1~bpo9+1) over (4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1) ... > Preparing to unpack .../virtualbox-guest-dkms_5.1.30-dfsg-1~bpo9+1_all.deb ... > > -------- Uninstall Beginning -------- > Module: virtualbox-guest > Version: 4.3.36 > Kernel: 3.16.0-4-686-pae (i686) > ------------------------------------- > > Status: Before uninstall, this module version was ACTIVE on this kernel. > > vboxguest.ko: > - [details="Summary"] user@host:~$ sudo apt-get install virtualbox-guest-x11 [sudo] password for user: Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree Reading state information... Done Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable distribution that some required packages have not yet been created or been moved out of Incoming. The following information may help to resolve the situation:
The following packages have unmet dependencies: virtualbox-guest-x11 : Depends: xorg-video-abi-23 but it is not installable Depends: xserver-xorg-core (>= 2:1.18.99.901) but 2:1.16.4-1+deb8u2 is to be installed E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages. [/details]

item.title: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade
item.dc:creator: Widgi
item.description:
It’s works! Many thanks for your help Patrick!

Read full topic
item.source: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade

item.title: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
sudo apt-get purge virtualbox-guest-x11 virtualbox-guest-utils virtualbox-guest-dkms
sudo apt-get autoremove
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install virtualbox-guest-x11 virtualbox-guest-utils virtualbox-guest-dkms
sudo apt-get install -f

Read full topic

item.source: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade

item.title: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Widgi:

proposed-updates

Thank you for using proposed-updates! This might safe a lot users a lot trouble.

Technical stuff:

Only https://packages.debian.org/stretch-backports/virtualbox-guest-x11 dep: xorg-video-abi-23. 5.1.30-dfsg-1~bpo9+1

It was uploaded to Whonix repository. It is probably because back then there was no 5.x version (we used VirtualBox 5.x for some reason) in jessie let alone jessie-backports. There is just too much issues/details and too much fast moving packages for a single person to develop, document, and maintain.

Anyhow. I removed 5.1.30-dfsg-1~bpo9+1 from Whonix jessie-proposed-updates since guest additions are now available from 5.x Debian’s jessie-backports.

Could you please run sudo apt-get update and then try again to install it from jessie-backports?

(Now that the too-new and unsuitable version from Whonix repository is gone, it might work.)

Read full topic
item.source: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade

item.title: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade
item.dc:creator: Algernon
item.description:
What kind of upgrade was this? To stretch or still only for jessie? The xserver-xorg-core version (>= 2:1.18.99.901) which the guest additions depend on seem to be available only for stretch but not for jessie. There is also no relevant version in jessie-backports. In case some packages are only available from stretch you might want to try this procedure: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Upgrading_Whonix_13_to_Whonix_14
Note that it is testers only.

Read full topic
item.source: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade

item.title: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade
item.dc:creator: Widgi
item.description:
Dear Patrick, many thanks for your reply.

user@host:~$ sudo apt-get -t jessie-backports install xserver-xorg-core
Reading package lists… Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information… Done
xserver-xorg-core is already the newest version.
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 125 not upgraded.

Same with other packages. Package xorg-video-abi-23 not available in this repo.

Read full topic
item.source: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade

item.title: Broken VBOX guest-additions after last upgrade
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Perhaps try installing from jessie-backports. Make a backup beforehand so you don’t further break it.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Install_Software#Backports

Read full topic
